metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27619 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Python 3 through 3.9.0, the Lib/test/multibytecodec_support.py CJK codec tests call eval() on content retrieved via HTTP.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10').
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
